About:
 Primary colors are any of a group of colors from
 which all other colours can be obtained by mixing.
 In real world applications the most common colors
 chosen are red, blue, and yellow. When it come to
 representing colors digitally, the RGB24 (red, green,
 blue) model is most popular. This scheme restricts the
 number of available values to 8 bits in three color
 channels with values of 0–255. This means that any
 given color can be one of 16,777,216 possible colors.
 This App lets you play around with this model and lets
 you generate your own "unique" colors.
 The generated values are then converted into
 Hexadecimal and HSV representation.

 How to Use:
 Move the slider to select a value from 0 to 255.
 Do this for each primary color to get your desired
 color. When a desired color is found you can copy the
 hexadecimal value to your clipboard (via the save option
 from the menu in the top right). You can also generate
 random colors, if desired.
